quick-guide.description: Quick guide about using drawing tools in Leopard

subsections.name: Arc Tool
steps: 1. Click on the screen or type the coordinate in the *Command Line* for the base point of the arc.
2. Click on the screen or type the coordinate in the *Command Line* for the curvature point of the arc.
3. Click on the screen or type the coordinate in the *Command Line* for the end point of the arc.

subsections.name: Line Tool
text: If only the length is passed for the second point onwards, the line will be a straight line, in `x`, which will have the passed value as the distance between its initial and final points.
steps: 1. Click on the screen or type the coordinate in the *Command Line* for the first point.
2. Click on the screen, type the coordinate in the *Command Line*, or pass the value of its length for the next points.
